column5: Our first Colorado low of the year. 30 cm and near blizzard conditions for you northern guys and a snow then rain then snow again mix for us down here. Not sure which is worse. Drive safe everyone!!  Weather Network Video Report
I'd rather take the snow Rick.. born and raised in Sudbury... I can't stand the slushy messy stuff!
there was at least 20 cms eastern gbay last wknd.  you guys are behind.
Really the first???  We got 52 cm here on Saturday...2nd most in all of Canada that day.
You guys got lake effect snow. I live between two of the great lakes and still don't have any snow..need some though to track them coyotes!
They say 'tween 25 and 35cms tomorrow for us.  Powered up the snow thrower on the weekend....it started and runs great. Now let's just hope that J is not too tired to use it.
We live between three of the great lakes and still havent been really hit too hard.  I want a big blizzard.
I'm in a quandary. Can't decide whether to throw my gear in the truck enroute to work today. Normally I leave straight from the office Wed mornings to go fishing...
Geeze Roy..  I see why J does it, can be tough to see over the snow piles for some folks
You don't have ice yet do you?
ice first Kinger...Ice first
No....im sure the small lakes do, but that is all kiboshed know...last year on opening weekend there was an inch of ice...the rest was snow and slush...not looking good to start this year again.

One good thing about the move is we alrady have safe (ish) ice. Was out on the weekend after stocked trout, nothing.  But -33 windchill this morning is tightening things up. Barely enough snow to cover the ground though.
lemme tell you how awesome it was hiking down the 300 foot vertical hill into the river!!!
actually..i have been waiting to hear the story
ewww
Frig i take the Snow day in Orillia.  Frig meh i might still take the day off LOL
I wanna get in to a spot between Christmas and Newyears...darned springs there though
DANG... I might have to call in sick.. might not be able to make the 18' walk to work...
Few inches of rain and freezing rain due in this evening and throughout the night.   Tomorrow supposed to each around 40 and could have some heavy rain.  Sounds like a heck of a mess.
My my my! It's gonna snow in Canada in the wintertime????... who'da ever thunk it?  It's 63*F here right now at 7:15 p.m.
